name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Malware Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where an attacker leveraged PowerShell to execute commands on a target machine, leading to malware installation.

action--3d5c4ba3-f9d8-4f29-bd3f-c5e9c567.name: Kill malicious process
action--3d5c4ba3-f9d8-4f29-bd3f-c5e9c567.description: Terminate any processes that are considered suspicious.

action--2bcd6464-ada4-4df0-b1d6-7e515e53.name: Isolate infected host
action--2bcd6464-ada4-4df0-b1d6-7e515e53.description: Isolate the host to prevent further spread of the malware.

while-condition--731c57f9-3ded-4d9a-bf3f.name: Run malware scan loop
while-condition--731c57f9-3ded-4d9a-bf3f.description: Continuously scan for malware until the system is clean.

action--4b365b6a-5c3d-45f2-b216-d3c456ab.name: Review system logs for anomalies
action--4b365b6a-5c3d-45f2-b216-d3c456ab.description: Check system logs for any potentially harmful actions.

action--8c5830a5-ff1b-4de4-a210-f447c608.name: Patch vulnerabilities
action--8c5830a5-ff1b-4de4-a210-f447c608.description: Ensure that the system is updated to prevent future incidents.

commands.command: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
